p: During a pandemic, the consent process may change because the risk and benefit ratio may alter. For example, cancer patients need to know that anticancer therapy could carry greater risk during a pandemic. In addition, access to hospital beds will be limited both by increased demand and by potential staff shortage. In this circumstance, patients may well make an informed choice for a potentially less efficacious but less myelosuppressive treatment 9. Additionally, the risk of surgery may carry the risk of nosocomial infection with the pandemic pathogen.
